items.description: Tidal Thames riverside from Putney Bridge to Teddington Weir
items.eaAreaName: Kent, South London and East Sussex

floodArea.county: Greater London, Hammersmith and Fulham, Hounslow, Richmond upon Thames, Wandsworth

items.message:
River levels are expected to be high as a result of spring tides.

The forecast high tide at Richmond is 4.73mAOD at 16:00 on 01/04/22.

Flooding of low-lying roads and footpaths is expected, which may exist for one to two hours either side of high tide. Flooding of properties is not expected.

We believe there is a possibility of flooding for Putney Embankment (SW15), Chiswick Mall and Strand on the Green (W4), Thames Bank at Mortlake (SW14), Ranelagh Drive (TW1), Friars Lane and Water Lane (TW9), Riverside and The Embankment at Twickenham, and the Towpath below Teddington Lock. 

Astronomical tide levels are rising. The river flow at Teddington Weir is normal for this time of year at 45 cubic metres per second and is steady. We anticipate the flows to remain normal for the next five days.

We are closely monitoring the situation.

This message will be updated by 19:00 on 01/04/22, or as the situation changes.

items.description: The Essex coast at Coalhouse Fort and surrounding marshland
items.message: Levels are now below the flood warning threshold. We do not currently expect to re-issue this flood warning in the coming days. We will continue to monitor levels closely.

This Flood Alert has been removed. The next high tide is expected at Trowlock at 15:30 today 01/04/22 and is forecast to reach around 4.80 to 4.85m. The following high tide is expected at 03:45 tonight 02/04/22 and is forecast to reach around 4.65 to 4.70m. We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert if necessary. Please remain safe and aware of your local surroundings and refer to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels.

items.description: The Essex coast from Clacton to and including, St Peters Flat and the Colne and Blackwater estuaries
items.message: We do not currently expect to re-issue this flood alert over the next couple of days. We will continue to monitor levels closely.
